title: Central Jersey theater’s poet-in-residence to bring words online
body: State Theatre artist-in-residence Glenis Redmond will give a free poetry reading online 7 p.m. Wednesday, April 14.State Theatre’s artist-in-residence Glenis Redmond will host a free online community poetry reading on Zoom 7 p.m. Wednesday, April 14.Billed as a National Poetry Month celebration, the program will start with Redmond performing poetry from her 20-plus-year career. She then will be joined by some of the aspiring poets she has guided and inspired to create to tell their own personal stories through poetry.Redmond is an award-winning poet and educator from South Carolina. Her poems relate tales from her life, her family, her African-American heritage and her observations of the world around her.In addition to her stint at the New Brunswick theater, Redmond is a teaching artist with the Kennedy Center in Washington, D.C.; poet-in-residence at the Peace Center in Greenville, S.C.; and a featured performer on National Public Radio and TEDx.The reading is free but reservations are required.
